item.title: Rubbish all over pavement and blowing around, 30th October
item.description:
The bins are overflowing with bin bags placed on the floor. They are then left out on the pavement and are ripped apart by foxes. These bins are not only causing obstructions they are causing huge amounts of rubbish including chicken carcass and other food items to be on the pavement. It was again difficult to get to my car with my 2 year old and small baby. As need to walk on the road to avoid walking on the rubbish. I am now making a second report about the bin issue here which has been going on for years. I have tried to ignore but it is becoming increasingly disgusting and makes walking on the pavement difficult

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Amberley Court, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Residential rubbish dumped again on doorstep, 30th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Leinster Terrace, Bayswater, London

item.title: Large vat of car oil has been left next to the path by the now closed Jaw Automotive, its filling with water when it rains and will go everywhere if not contained, 30th October
item.description:
Large vat of car oil has been left next to the path by the now closed Jaw Automotive, its filling with water when it rains and will go everywhere if not contained. The owners sold up so there is nobody who can deal with this can we get this cleared before it spills into the waterwayes?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Market Meadow, Poverest, London

item.description:

item.title: Next to 161 Green Walk, 30th October
item.description:
This abandoned car has been sitting here for a few years and nobody has come to move it or claim it L&Q are going to be selling the site off and the car will need to be removed. It is down the alleyway where the garages are located. The metal gate has padlock which will require a FB14 key to unlock metal gates

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Walk, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet
